intro: Atalaya oligoclada, commonly known as the white-flowered atalaya, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately lobed and often have a hairy texture. Atalaya oligoclada is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as cloud forests.
